  • Method Details

    • myLaunch

      public static void myLaunch(Class<? extends javafx.application.Application> applicationClass)
      Launches a JavaFX application in a separate thread if it's the first time the method is called. For subsequent calls, it initializes and starts a new instance of the provided application class on the JavaFX Application Thread. It's a way to avoid the fact that an Application subclass can be launched only once, with this method you can play how mani games you want choosing every time between cli or gui
      Parameters:
      applicationClass - the class of the JavaFX Application to be launched

    • start

      public void start(javafx.stage.Stage primaryStage) throws Exception
      Initializes and starts the primary stage for the JavaFX application.

      This method sets up the initial scene by loading the "StartingScene.fxml" file, setting the stage title, icon, and scene, and then displaying the stage. It also sets up a close request handler for the stage.

      Specified by:
      start in class javafx.application.Application
      Parameters:
      primaryStage - the primary stage for this JavaFX application
      Throws:
      Exception - if there is any issue loading the FXML file or setting up the stage

    • getBoardString

      Specified by:
      getBoardString in interface UserInterfaceStrategy

    • initializeScenes

      public void initializeScenes()
      Initializes all the scenes and their respective controllers.

      This method loads several FXML files for different scenes and sets their controllers. This allows the application to access and use methods from these controllers even if the user has not yet navigated to these scenes.

      The scenes initialized are:

      • Starting Scene
      • Board Scene
      • Waiting for Players Scene
      • Choosing Starter Scene
      • Choosing Objective Scene

      If any FXML file fails to load, the exception is caught and the stack trace is printed.

    • changeScene

      public void changeScene(String sceneName, javafx.stage.Stage stage)
      Changes the current scene displayed in the provided stage to the specified scene.

      This method switches the current scene to the one specified by the `sceneName` parameter. It initializes the new scene and its controller as needed. The method supports several predefined scenes:

      • Starting Scene
      • Waiting for Players Scene
      • Board Scene
      • Choosing Starter Scene
      • Choosing Objective Scene
      Parameters:
      sceneName - the name of the FXML file for the scene to be displayed
      stage - the stage in which the scene will be displayed

    • showErrorPopUp

      public void showErrorPopUp(String message, javafx.stage.Stage errorStage)
      Displays an error pop-up window with the specified message.

      This method creates a new pop-up window to show an error message. The pop-up is centered near the specified error stage's current position. The pop-up is loaded from the "ErrorPopUp.fxml" file and uses a scale transition for its appearance animation.

      Parameters:
      message - the error message to be displayed in the pop-up
      errorStage - the stage near which the error pop-up will be displayed

    • showScoreboardPopUp

      public void showScoreboardPopUp(javafx.stage.Stage errorStage)
      Displays a scoreboard pop-up window near the specified stage.

      This method creates a new pop-up window to display the scoreboard. The pop-up is centered near the specified stage's current position. The pop-up is loaded from the "Scoreboard.fxml" file and uses a scale transition for its appearance animation.

      The scoreboard pop-up is shown as a modal, non-resizable, and transparent window.

      Parameters:
      errorStage - the stage near which the scoreboard pop-up will be displayed

    • showErrorPopUpNoStage

      public void showErrorPopUpNoStage(String message)
      Displays an error pop-up window with the specified message.

      This method creates a new pop-up window to show an error message. The pop-up is loaded from the "ErrorPopUp.fxml" file and uses a scale transition for its appearance animation. The position of the pop-up is determined by the coordinates stored in `xStage` and `yStage`.

      The error pop-up is shown as a modal, non-resizable, and transparent window that is always on top.

      Parameters:
      message - the error message to be displayed in the pop-up

    • gameStarted

      public void gameStarted()
      Handles the transition to the "Waiting for Players" scene if the game was waiting for players.

      This method checks if the game was in a state of waiting for players (indicated by the `wasWaitingForPlayers` flag). If so, it changes the current scene to the "Waiting for Players" scene on the JavaFX Application Thread.

      Specified by:
      gameStarted in interface UserInterfaceStrategy

    • chooseObjective

      public void chooseObjective(List<Objective> obj)
      Initiates the selection of objectives on the JavaFX Application Thread.

      This method receives a list of objectives and prepares to handle the selection process on the JavaFX Application Thread. It sets the received objectives as the secret objectives and prepares to invoke the chooseObjective() method on the appropriate controller once it's loaded.

      Specified by:
      chooseObjective in interface UserInterfaceStrategy
      Parameters:
      obj - the list of objectives to be selected

    • setStarterSide

      public void setStarterSide()
      Specified by:
      setStarterSide in interface UserInterfaceStrategy

    • visualiseStarterCardLoaded

      public void visualiseStarterCardLoaded(Card card)
      Visualizes the starter card loaded asynchronously on the JavaFX Application Thread.

      This method sets the starter card using the provided card parameter. It ensures that this operation is performed on the JavaFX Application Thread using Platform.runLater().

      Specified by:
      visualiseStarterCardLoaded in interface UserInterfaceStrategy
      Parameters:
      card - the starter card to be visualized

    • updateDecks

      public void updateDecks(List<Card> updatedDecks)
      Updates the decks of cards asynchronously on the JavaFX Application Thread.

      This method updates the decks of cards with the provided updatedDecks parameter. It checks if the board scene has been loaded before attempting to update the decks, ensuring that the update operation is performed only when the board scene is ready.

      If the board scene is ready (indicated by notYetBoardScene), it calls updateDecks() on the board view controller to apply the updates.

      Specified by:
      updateDecks in interface UserInterfaceStrategy
      Parameters:
      updatedDecks - the updated list of decks to be applied

    • currentTurn

      public void currentTurn(PlayableCardIds data)
      Updates the UI to indicate the current player's turn asynchronously on the JavaFX Application Thread.

      This method sets the current player's turn status to true in the client's model view. If the board scene has not been loaded yet (indicated by notYetBoardScene), it initiates a scene change to the "BoardScene.fxml". After ensuring the board scene is ready, it delegates the task of selecting a card to play to the board view controller.

      Specified by:
      currentTurn in interface UserInterfaceStrategy
      Parameters:
      data - the playable card IDs for the current turn

    • updateMyPlayerState

      public void updateMyPlayerState()
      Updates the state of the current player asynchronously on the JavaFX Application Thread.

      This method updates the state of the current player by invoking updateMyPlayerstate() on the board view controller. This operation is performed asynchronously on the JavaFX Application Thread to ensure UI-related tasks are handled properly.

      Specified by:
      updateMyPlayerState in interface UserInterfaceStrategy

    • updatePlayerState

      public void updatePlayerState(String player)
      Updates the state of a specific player asynchronously on the JavaFX Application Thread.

      This method updates the state of the player identified by player by invoking updatePlayerstate(player) on the board view controller. This operation is performed asynchronously on the JavaFX Application Thread to ensure UI-related tasks are handled properly.

      Specified by:
      updatePlayerState in interface UserInterfaceStrategy
      Parameters:
      player - the name or identifier of the player whose state is to be updated

    • showAvailableAngles

      public void showAvailableAngles(List<Coordinate> data)
      Displays available angles for a player's action asynchronously on the JavaFX Application Thread.

      This method displays the available angles for a player's action by invoking askForAngle(data) on the board view controller. This operation is performed asynchronously on the JavaFX Application Thread to ensure UI-related tasks are handled properly.

      Specified by:
      showAvailableAngles in interface UserInterfaceStrategy
      Parameters:
      data - a list of coordinates representing the available angles

    • askWhereToDraw

      public void askWhereToDraw(List<Card> cards)
      Asks the player where to draw cards from asynchronously on the JavaFX Application Thread.

      This method prompts the player to choose where to draw cards from by invoking drawFromDecks() on the board view controller. This operation is performed asynchronously on the JavaFX Application Thread to ensure UI-related tasks are handled properly.

      Specified by:
      askWhereToDraw in interface UserInterfaceStrategy
      Parameters:
      cards - a list of cards indicating the available decks or sources from which cards can be drawn

    • displayHand

      public void displayHand(List<Card> hand)
      Displays the player's hand of cards asynchronously on the JavaFX Application Thread.

      This method displays the player's hand of cards by invoking updateHand(hand) on the board view controller, provided that the board scene has already been loaded (indicated by notYetBoardScene being false). This operation is performed asynchronously on the JavaFX Application Thread to ensure UI-related tasks are handled properly.

      Specified by:
      displayHand in interface UserInterfaceStrategy
      Parameters:
      hand - a list of cards representing the player's current hand

    • showNotYourTurn

      public void showNotYourTurn()
      Displays a message indicating that it's not the player's turn asynchronously on the JavaFX Application Thread.

      This method checks if the board scene has not been loaded yet (indicated by notYetBoardScene), and if so, it initiates a scene change to "BoardScene.fxml". If messageJustSent is false, it displays a message indicating that it's not the player's turn using message("It's not your turn") on the board view controller. It also updates the client's model view to reflect that it's not the player's turn and manages a timer task to periodically check the connection status by sending a message.

      Specified by:
      showNotYourTurn in interface UserInterfaceStrategy

    • newChatMessage

      public void newChatMessage(Message message)
      Processes a new chat message asynchronously on the JavaFX Application Thread.

      This method updates the chat interface with a new message by invoking updateChat(message) on the board view controller. This operation is performed asynchronously on the JavaFX Application Thread to ensure UI-related tasks are handled properly.

      Specified by:
      newChatMessage in interface UserInterfaceStrategy
      Parameters:
      message - the new chat message to be displayed

    • lastTurn

      public void lastTurn()
      Notifies the player that it is their last turn asynchronously on the JavaFX Application Thread.

      This method displays a message indicating that it is the player's last turn by invoking message("This is your Last Turn \n Play carefully!") on the board view controller. This operation is performed asynchronously on the JavaFX Application Thread to ensure UI-related tasks are handled properly.

      Specified by:
      lastTurn in interface UserInterfaceStrategy

    • endGame

      public void endGame(List<javafx.util.Pair<String,Integer>> rank)
      Processes the end of the game asynchronously on the JavaFX Application Thread.

      This method handles the end of the game by invoking gameEnded() if the board scene has not been loaded yet (indicated by notYetBoardScene). Otherwise, it updates the game interface with the final ranking by invoking endGameRanking(rank) on the board view controller. This operation is performed asynchronously on the JavaFX Application Thread to ensure UI-related tasks are handled properly.

      Specified by:
      endGame in interface UserInterfaceStrategy
      Parameters:
      rank - a list of pairs containing player names and their corresponding scores in the final ranking

    • closeError

      public void closeError()
      Closes any active error handling and disconnects the client from the game.

      This method cancels any active timers and sends a message to the client to exit the game. It is typically called to handle the closure of error pop-ups or to manage disconnections from the game.

    • gameEnded

      public void gameEnded()
      Handles the end of the game asynchronously on the JavaFX Application Thread.

      This method cancels any active timers and closes the current stage (window) associated with the game. It is typically called when the game has ended to perform cleanup tasks and close the game window.
